TopicTitle: Why are the feet on my landing gear inverted?

Articles.Content:
Hi all, searched and didn't find.

So I have this science vessel lander, it's supposed to be able to hit two biomes per launch on the Mun (more on Minmus) before returning to kerbin:

http://imgur.com/a/k7PVL

Notice that the landing gear appears to behave correctly in the VAB.

When I get into space, the landing gear does something funny:

http://imgur.com/a/IlwBv

 

Whaaaa? I thought it might have something to do with facing, some of my components are upside-down and others are manually rotated afterwards (I was experimenting with an appollo-like dedicated lander stage that needed a stack separator and had to do an in-space rearrangement to get all the pieces aligned properly). But I flipped the one piece I know is backwards (the fuel tank for the lander engine) and nothing changed.

Thoughts? I can actually land like this it's just annoying and comical.
Feet are hinged. Do not worry, they will be facing the right way when you land.
yea they've been doing this sunce 1.1 for me. i havent noticed a difference when trying to land, they tend to just fix them selves when you touch down
